reviews.text: This place was awesome!! So much information and all of it interesting. Our group spent three hours there and that was definitely not enough time. There were so many hangers with a wide range of planes and artifacts we could have easily spent five hours there without seeing everything! A few of the planes were actually open to walk through so that was really cool seeing the inside. I walked through Air Force One and a space shuttle! Overall really cool experience completely free of charge.

Excellent museum. The layout is fantastic with a good flow allowing for a large amount of aircraft and displays without appearing cluttered. Many of the displays had retired Air Force pilots and aircrew next to them who had flown those aircraft and talking to them was a real treat. Depending on how much you want to see and read, you could easily spend days here. The WWII section and presidential aircraft stand out as highlights of a truly fantastic selection. Make the time to stop by. You need at least an hour here, but 2-3 hours would allow you to see most of the displays. Admission is free and it is very family friendly. Don’t bring water, food, knives, guns, etc because you will be turned away. Enjoy!

A must see for anyone! If you only have a limited amount of time, take the guided tour of the first hanger. It takes about 1.5 hours but the guides are excellent and super knowledgeable. 
It’s a great place for kids too. My girls (1 and 3) love visiting and seeing all the planes. Unless you can dedicate an entire day, plan on visiting several times so you can see it all.

What a wonderful experience the National Air force Museum brings. A great place for families to spend time together.  Also very affordable considering it is free to enter. They have a store where you can purchase souvenirs and they also take your photo when you first come in that with a small fee you can pick up at the end of journey. There are simulator rides for the whole family to enjoy. I would plan a whole day to really enjoy and embrace the history of the Museum.

An extensive and amazing collection of aircraft, rockets and exotic vehicles. It's worth a while day of exploring. A lot of history and inspiration. Great for children. Get there early to try out some of the simulators. Staff is very helpful and getting around is easy. Expect to walk a lot!

Great small museum. There are tours of the cycle company throughout the day but otherwise it is closed. 
The visitor’s center has some excellent exhibits and my girls had a blast. Give yourself about an hour to walk through the museum in the visitor’s center. A little longer if you like to read everything. The visit to the cycle shop only takes about 20 minutes.

The Walking tour of 7 Hawthorne Street and 22 Williams Street is well worth your time. Huffman Prairie is also a must. Several museums are added attractions. The grave site is worthwhile time well spent. The Aviation Experience is only complete after a visit here and Kill Devil Hill in North Carolina.

Interesting educational place to learn about the Wright Brothers their cycle shops, experiments and about life in their time. Well preserved/recreated neighborhood look and excellent exhibits. Add this place to your Air Force Museum visit too!
Very interesting. Had a great time with family. The rangers we're helpful and informative. It was clean and well lit and the kids learned a lot!

Do visit!!! 
Great staff!
Wonderful exhibits!
I love this place!
Great place for kids and adults anytime of the year. Amazing gift shop. If you go.in the spring and summer, make sure you wear bug repellent.
Really nice place. I been working there for a little bit helping to build on! The food at the Brewery is great! Alot of nice things to see! Makes a great day to just spend the day with the family!

This place is so neat.
It's like walking through history.
I enjoy going in the spring & summer and walking through all the different buildings.
Learning about the Wright Brothers & Dayton.
If history is something you're interested in, you should check it out!

If you have kids, it's an adventure for them.
They may not be too excited about the history of it, but they will enjoy walking through the trains, playing with the registers.
They have a kids area, a merry-go-round & and a little show about the history. 
(The show might be a little spooky with the lights that flash and the characters).
Staff here dress in actual dress from the era. The beverages are made with 1800 like methods, thus educating people who patronize this Dayton local brew pub.
Very cool place. Probably more for older children and adults but lots of cool things to look at. They also have a cool carousel that the kids will like.

Great opportunities and classes at Dayton Ballet School. 
Not only do they get to share the same space as the professional company, the students have the opportunity to be chosen to be part of the professional productions by Dayton Ballet Company. 
My kids have enjoyed being part of The Nutcracker and other shows performed at the Schuster Center and Victoria Theater.

Good if you're on-base and want to expand your education and training. Better options elsewhere for more general science and engineering, but this one is specialized for military and defense applications, so if you want to go down that career/education route, this is the place to go.

The turkey chili is by far the best bang for buck deal you're gonna get at Einstein's, otherwise the education was nice.

Over all it was fast, neat, average, friendly, good, good

yea i was there with some great  guys, together we graduated
i ma tell ya i loved the school
Great school to learn additional engineering knowledge. The instructor are knowledgeable and entertaining.
4 great schools with outstanding faculty, staff, students, and labs!

I love the Chop House. The food is hands down the best in Ann Arbor. We always go for the cheese platter appetizer and it is some of the best you will find. The prices are a little steep but once you taste the food, it is well worth it. The cocktails are alright and they need a bit more mixing before being served as they aren't a uniform flavor but outside of that, I highly recommend this place for an anniversary or birthday or just a nice date. Their cigar lounge is high quality and the atmosphere is perfect. I will always come back to this place.

A couple weeks ago, we enjoyed a dinner elsewhere in Ann Arbor and decided to head to Chop House after for an espresso and cigar. After a half mile walk we arrive to find out the cigar bar is non smoking due to a private party. Fine. No problem, we should have called. Tonight, we did the same thing. Except we called first to make sure the cigar lounge was open, we called, yes it’s open. Perfect, we walk there. Guess what, closed. Continuous bad service from this place. It’s overpriced we all know that, but it used to at least have good service. Not anymore. Save yourself the dull experience and go to the steak house around the corner.

The steaks were tender and thick and all of the appetizers were great. We also had very good service. It's a pretty fancy establishment. And they offer great discounts for birthdays. Roughly enough to make the birthday persons meal free, given that it's on the actual birthday.

Went here on two occasions. One was my girlfriend's birthday. It was a wonderful time. The staff were friendly and very speedy, and food was amazing. However, when I went for my club's business conference, it was a bit hectic-- understandably. Several orders were messed up, but they were corrected surprisingly fast. Overall, a great place to dine!

Pretty awesome place. Went doing restaurant week where you get a 3 course meal or something for $28. I ended up taking my wife for her birthday and got their birthday discount. Got the 11oz steak, calamari, mashed potatoes, and asparagus. All was good. Bathroom was nice and clean but a little intimate since everything is in one little corner. Ambience was great. Recommend seeing Kiara for best service. Overall great experience.
Good food, good prices, open past eight pm. Both the Japanese restaurant next door and House of Thai are connected and you can go from one to the other through the inside. Two restaurants in one!
Food is great but service can be worked on. Had to wait about 15 minutes before having our order taken
Great selection, try one plate of everything
Everything was fresh and delicious. The price won't break you and the staff is friendly and courteous. #winning

Our server was amazing and the food was great . Just a little bland but that maybe because I asked them to make my vegetarian dishes vegan. But they were super nice about accommodating my vegan diet ! I plan to come back again !
Was 110% Great meal and Service. All. Thank you. And your  Hostess  was a great  personality. She makes your store. Good  job!

Usually pretty good.  I haven't had a bad experience but it's been close.  Service is about as slow as it gets, but I come to expect it now.  They have the games you want to watch.  I like the Chicago style Italian beef sub and the BBQ chicken pizza.  The beer selection is good but don't expect the bartender to know anything but random trendy mixed drinks.  It is a chain now.  Treat it as such.  There will be pitfalls.  Take then in stride.

I had some kind of Italian sub, which had delicious meats, pesto, and big pieces of milk mozzarella. It tasted very good. I ordered the large, and saved half for the second day. It tasted great even then.

We had an enjoyable lunch. I decided to try their new pizza in the menu while my boyfriend ordered a large cheese pizza with mushrooms. Everything was prepared fresh and was tasty. The service was good too. Will definitely visit this place again in the near future.

The food was DELICIOUS, and the service was AMAZING- our server was also tending the bar and he still took AMAZING care of us. If you're in the area around the University of Dayton, I'd HIGHLY recommend this establishment

You've had the rest, now quit fooling around and have the best. Thai 9 is the absolute best Thai food in the area. I feel so fortunate to have a restaurant that offers up the quality of food you'll find here at reasonable prices. Beautiful decor inside with food to match. I wouldn't want to eat anywhere else!

Delicious food and fast service. A little pricey compared to other Thai restaurants but the food is excellent. Love the crab ragoons. Also,  like that I can get a variety of fresh  sushi with the other traditional Thai dishes. The tofu is always good right here. The desserts here are good too.

Amazing experience! Just ate here for the first time and it was exceptional. The food was so good and the sushi was very fresh, best we've ever had. Our server Bronson was very helpful with the menu and knowledgeable about the food. He was very bright and happy! Loved everything about our experience.

Absolutely loved this place. The food was fresh and there was not a long wait at all. The servers were very friendly and the restaurant was a great environment. I almost forgot I was in Ohio. Definitely recommend!

First time ordering the Singapore Noodles with chicken. Spice Level: 4. It was delicious and very filling. I took half of it home for dinner! Service was quick and friendly. Love the salad and sweet onion dressing. Great place for lunch or dinner!

This is my favorite restaurant in Dayton area.  I've been going here for around 20 years.  I would highly recommend one of the meal sized soups, like saté style (#37) and the soft shrimp roll (#2) is amazing. Everyone I've brought for the 1st time always loves these, and the peanut sauce they come with is a mind expanding experience.  The crispy egg noodles (#61) are also a favorite. The fried bananas are a perfect dessert (#184). I have also never been disappointed when trying new dishes of the menu

I don't know where to start when it comes to Little Saigon. Their food is AMAZING! Sincerely, it is so good and flavorful with so many options I know I will never try them all. I maintain they have the best friend spring rolls in the area. They have such delicious Vietnamese dishes with such a huge selection you just have to see their menu to understand. The staff there is so sweet and nice and try so hard to make sure you enjoy your experience. I also think the prices are reasonable, especially with the portions you receive.
Food is great! A good place to get rice when I'm craving for it. Lol. Try their crab rangoon.  It's the best. I also love their fresh spring rolls. 😊

This adorable little Resturaunt was pleasant, and the staff were fun and easy to talk to. Not to mention the food was AMAZING. It was incredible flavorful and there we so many options! Overall, a very VERY good place to eat of your looking to try something new and filling!

This place is a gem! The staff is great, the variety and selection of dishes are extensive and the food itself is amazing. If you enjoy vietnamese food or Asian food in general, this is one of the truly authentic Asian restaurants in the Dayton area. You will not be dissapointed!

I have been here Twice and both times I have been very impressed. I absolutely love the food and service. We come here for a dinner party at the end of the year. And it’s very enjoyable. The staff treat us very nice.

I ho here pretty often for work lunches and I have never been served a bad grilled cheese or tomato bisque soup. Always delicious! 
I also recommend the Bourbon Street Salad too. 
Arrive at 1145 am and you'll get a seat with no wait.

Loved everything about our recent visit.  We sat at the bar, since the restaurant was packed (make reservations). The salmon was outstanding,  cooked on point.  Manhattan was the drink of choice,  it was made perfectly.  We took Scampi home for our son who was blown away by how good it was even after a drive home. We will definitely be eating here again.

Such a laid back atmosphere when you consider how polished everything is. The chef knows what he's doing and the servers are top notch. I'm just a middle class guy but, I feel important for an hour or two when I'm here.
The ambience is nice. The food temperature was tepid, wish it was hotter.  My pasta dish sauce was very nice, but the pasta tasted chalky and texture was off.  Nice place to drink wine.

The deli side has a great variety of sandwiches, pizzas, and salads. More Importantly,  the various sandwiches I have tried have all been winners. The beer selection is decent with a nice selection of local breweries. The selection of arcade games to play is nice and they are free. Pinball is the only game that might cost you some money but even that is fairly priced. 

Parking is the only somewhat difficult aspect, but what parking doesn't suck in Dayton?

Really cool place. We found it online and it definitely didn't disappoint. We had a couple drinks and played old arcade games. It was super fun. One thing I don't know if I saw online when we found this place, you do have to pay for the pinball machines. Not a dealer breaker at all, just not sure if it is widely advertised. All of the other arcade games are free though and it offers a really cool atmosphere. Highly recommend stopping by.

The Canal Street Arcade is a very unique and cool place. It's like a bar, restaurant, arcade, and museum all at the same time.There are lots of cool arcade games and they are all free except the pinball machine, which cost more to maintain. This place is kid friendly with an adult up to a certain time, so maybe call ahead if you are traveling. The food is amazing, compliments to the chef, and they have a good selection of craft, domestic, and import beers. The bartender, Becky, was very cool and knows her stuff behind the bar. She is a fun person to talk to. Again, very cool place, I really enjoyed the experience.

I had the best Italian sandwich I've ever had in my life here today! Amazing. They also have an extensive selection of beer on tap, so bring your growler. The games are a plus as well. They are always working too witch is nice. Great little spot.

Some of the best sandwiches ever! The games are all free (except pinball) and they have an awesome selection. They also have a really good beer selection and you can buy cans and bottles to carry out as well.
